content: One aspect of the writing of DFW, DeLillo, and others of that era and ilk is their seeming need to simultaneously tell and explain a story, as though they can’t trust the reader to perceive the metaphor. Hence the endless internal monologues which, once you understand their purpose as a device to hold you by the hand while they assert their status as explainers of all things, serve only to grate. And yes, be occasionally amazed.
